method: First convert time to seconds: t = 30.0 min × 60 s/min = 1800 s. Calculate charge using Q = I × t: Q = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons using n(e-) = Q / F with F = 96500 C/mol: n(e-) = 2700 / 96500 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of Cu, so n(Cu) = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Calculate mass of copper using m = n × Ar with Ar(Cu) = 63.55: m = 0.01399 mol × 63.55 g/mol = 0.888 g.
